byline.contributor: Mark Scott contributed reporting from London.
byline.original: By AURELIEN BREEDEN and ALISSA J. RUBIN

abstract: Police in Paris detain Uber executives Pierre-Dimitri Gore-Coty and Thibaud Simphal in connection with investigation into company's low-cost UberPop service, which allows customers to book rides at lower rates with nonprofessional drivers; French Parliament authorized Uber's main services, but made UberPop option illegal.
lead_paragraph: The police acted in connection with a months-old investigation into the company’s low-cost UberPop service, which taxi drivers protested last week.

headline.main: 2 Uber Executives Questioned by Police in Paris
headline.print_headline: Paris Police Question Executives With Uber

snippet: The police acted in connection with a months-old investigation into the company’s low-cost UberPop service, which taxi drivers protested last week.
